net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.richtext

Class AbstractFeatureBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.richtext.AbstractFeatureBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteVisible, FeatureBehavior
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractClickFeatureBehavior, AbstractToggleFeatureBehavior

    abstract class AbstractFeatureBehavior
extends Object
implements FeatureBehavior
    This is the abstract base implementation of FeatureBehavior.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • setVisible

        public final void setVisible(boolean visible)
        This method shows or hides this object.
        Specified by:
        setVisible in interface AttributeWriteVisible
        Parameters:
        visible - is the new visibility status of this object. If true, the object will be shown (and raised), if false the object will be hidden (iconified).
        See Also:
        AttributeReadVisible.isVisible()

      • hasFontSettingsWidget

        protected boolean hasFontSettingsWidget()
        Returns:
        true if the font settings widget is available and has already been created, false otherwise.

      • updateToolbar

        public void updateToolbar()
        Updates the status of the FeatureBehavior in the toolbar widget after a change. E.g. toggle buttons are updated to reflect the current state.
        Specified by:
        updateToolbar in interface FeatureBehavior

      • createFontSettingsLabel

        See Also:
        getFontSettingsLabel()

      • getFontSettingsLabel

        public LabelWidget getFontSettingsLabel()
        Specified by:
        getFontSettingsLabel in interface FeatureBehavior
        Returns:
        the LabelWidget for the feature in the RichTextToolbar.FontSettingsPopup or null if not intended (e.g. toggle features use a CheckBox as popup widget and do not have a separate label).
